content:
• Tuesday, October 4, 2011
  • GPN

    More on Global Payments (NYSE:GPN): FQ1 earnings jumped 30% on strong international revenue...

    More on Global Payments (NYSE:GPN): FQ1 earnings jumped 30% on strong international revenue growth, which helped to offset rising operating expenses tied to stepped-up infrastructure investments and expansion efforts. The company lifts its earnings view for the year, now expecting between $3.46 to $3.54 per share. Shares +2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • AAL

    Analysts think AMR is in bad shape, but not bad enough to be driven to Chapter 11 anytime soon....

    Analysts think AMR is in bad shape, but not bad enough to be driven to Chapter 11 anytime soon. The company's unrestricted cash balance of $4.3B is well above the $3B Fitch thinks could portend bankruptcy, and Rodman & Renshaw believes any bankruptcy filing will be preceded by demands for labor concessions. (previously)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM

  • Network stocks are down after hours following Acme Packet (ACME) cutting Q3 guidance: Aruba...

    Network stocks are down after hours following Acme Packet (ACME) cutting Q3 guidance: Aruba Networks (ARUN, -2.5%), Ciena (CIEN, -2%), Juniper Networks (JNPR, -2.2%), F5 Networks (FFIV, -3.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • OCR

    Pharmacy services companies Omnicare (OCR -12%), and PharMerica (PMC -15.2%) crashed today on...

    Pharmacy services companies Omnicare (OCR -12%), and PharMerica (PMC -15.2%) crashed today on news of a government proposal to limit the quantity of drugs prescribed to elderly Medicare/Medicaid recipients. But J.P. Morgan is defending Omnicare, arguing its profits won't be materially impacted by such a move. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • YUM

    More on Yum Brands' (NYSE:YUM) FQ3 report: Same-store sales showed a 19% gain in China, helping...

    More on Yum Brands' (NYSE:YUM) FQ3 report: Same-store sales showed a 19% gain in China, helping lift the international division to a 3% profit gain. U.S. same-store sales declined 3%, contributing to 16% falloff in profit. Reconfirms full EPS growth forecast of at least 12%, and says it expects to open 600 new stores in China this year. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT), a maker of voice-over-IP infrastructure gear, drops 27% AH after...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT), a maker of voice-over-IP infrastructure gear, drops 27% AH after warning on its Q3 results. Acme expects Q3 revenue of ~$70M and EPS of $0.20-$0.22, below a consensus of $82.8M and $0.30. Though the company is reiterating its 2011 guidance, the market's response suggests it's skeptical.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +6.8%), which rose today on a Bloomberg report of a joint bid featuring Alibaba...

    Yahoo (YHOO +6.8%), which rose today on a Bloomberg report of a joint bid featuring Alibaba (OTC:ALBCF), is up 2.6% AH following a WSJ report claiming the company is preparing to send financial information to potential buyers. (last week)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • FCX

    While others raise alarm bells for aluminum (I, II), SocGen is doing so for copper, believing...

    While others raise alarm bells for aluminum (I, II), SocGen is doing so for copper, believing the all-important Chinese market is beginning to reduce its consumption. In spite of the report, and a 2.4% decline in copper futures, some miners rebounded sharply today. FCX +5.4%. RIO +3.7%.   (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 2 Comments

  • The news from Europe torches a few dollar bulls, as all of the "risk" currencies melt higher to...

    The news from Europe torches a few dollar bulls, as all of the "risk" currencies melt higher to the tune of 1% or more in the space of a few minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 9 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +8.8%) jumps after being named by Bank of America among semiconductor companies as...

    Nvidia (NVDA +8.8%) jumps after being named by Bank of America among semiconductor companies as “key beneficiaries” of smartphone demand. The news apparently helps lift the entire beaten-down sector; worries about declining demand has forced many chip makers to cut projections. Nvidia's got the cash and growth prospects to ride out the tough market, Trefis Team writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BAC

    U.S. banks are spiking on the news out of Europe, with Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) and Morgan...

    U.S. banks are spiking on the news out of Europe, with Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) and Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) having particularly sharp moves. Both stocks have jumped about 10% higher in the past few minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • DXBGY

    The WSJ reports flailing Dexia (OTCPK:DXBGY) will set up a bad bank to park €180B of...

    The WSJ reports flailing Dexia (OTCPK:DXBGY) will set up a bad bank to park €180B of assets, part of a larger plan that looks to essentially dismantle the lender ($2B market cap). France and Belgium will initially back the bad bank with guarantees, looking to eventually take over its ownership. (see also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • S

    Shares of Sprint (S +3.2) finally go back up again (previous) after Apple (AAPL -2.3%) ends the...

    Shares of Sprint (S +3.2) finally go back up again (previous) after Apple (AAPL -2.3%) ends the suspense and officially announces a 4S dual-core processor iPhone is available for Sprint customers beginning on Oct. 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • AEM

    As gold gets slammed, so do gold shares: Agnico Eagle (AEM -5.6%), New Gold (NGD -4.7%), U.S....

    As gold gets slammed, so do gold shares: Agnico Eagle (AEM -5.6%), New Gold (NGD -4.7%), U.S. Gold (UXG -13.3%), Randgold (GOLD -7.8%), Barrick Gold (ABX -5.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • APOG

    Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG), a maker of commercial glass products, is up 9.6% after D.A....

    Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG), a maker of commercial glass products, is up 9.6% after D.A. Davidson upgrades the company to Buy and sets a PT of $10.50. With shares down 37% since May on macro concerns, the firm thinks Apogee offers "attractive risk-return potential," and is encouraged by improvements in its backlog and financials.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott International (MDR -4.3%) is lower after getting cut from Goldman's conviction buy...

    McDermott International (MDR -4.3%) is lower after getting cut from Goldman's conviction buy list earlier. The firm says the sell-off following the company's Q2 results was overdone, but regardless, investors have less of an appetite for murky results these days.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -4.5%) is now selling off harder following its iEvent. While the iPhone 4S should be...

    Apple (AAPL -4.5%) is now selling off harder following its iEvent. While the iPhone 4S should be well-received, Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is likely breathing a sigh of relief, as the product wasn't the game-changer some feared. In particular, Apple's decision not to increase the iPhone's display size allows Android to maintain an edge in appealing to phone buyers who want more screen space. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 5 Comments
  • AEE

    Ameren (AEE -3.2%) takes a hit after saying its holding company, Ameren Energy Resources, will...

    Ameren (AEE -3.2%) takes a hit after saying its holding company, Ameren Energy Resources, will cease operating its Meredosia and Hutsonville energy centers by the end of 2011, resulting in the elimination of 90 positions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • ASR

    Mexican airline Grupo Aeroportuario del Sureste (ASR +3.8%) gets a lift after reporting its...

    Mexican airline Grupo Aeroportuario del Sureste (ASR +3.8%) gets a lift after reporting its passenger traffic for Sept. 2011 increased by 18.4% Y/Y, with an 11% jump in passenger bookings to its main Cancun hub.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM

  • After a one week respite from a steep downtrend, the precious metals are off sharply again...

    After a one week respite from a steep downtrend, the precious metals are off sharply again today. Gold drops back below $1,600/oz. and silver under $30 (platinum down too). GLD -3.2%, SLV -4.5%, PPLT -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy's (HELE +7.6%) is higher today after Wedbush ups the shares to neutral on...

    Helen of Troy's (HELE +7.6%) is higher today after Wedbush ups the shares to neutral on valuation. The firm says "moderating" input costs due to a gradual decline in spot prices for plastic resin should help gross margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • AAPL

    As was rumored, Apple (AAPL -2.2%) will offer a 64GB iPhone. Though the device will be sold at a...

    As was rumored, Apple (AAPL -2.2%) will offer a 64GB iPhone. Though the device will be sold at a relatively steep subsidized price of $399, Sandisk (SNDK +1%) has spiked a little on the news. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • IMAX

    IMAX moves +1.5% higher after Piper Jaffray raises estimates, saying company is likely to beat...

    IMAX moves +1.5% higher after Piper Jaffray raises estimates, saying company is likely to beat Q3 expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • AAPL

    The disappointing reaction to the new iPhone is sinking Apple (AAPL -2.6%) shares and dragging...

    The disappointing reaction to the new iPhone is sinking Apple (AAPL -2.6%) shares and dragging everything down with it, killing an earlier market comeback: Dow -151, S&P -9, Nasdaq -10.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • AAPL

    Shares of Pandora are off 12% today, losing traction early and trailing off even further after...

    Shares of Pandora are off 12% today, losing traction early and trailing off even further after Apple (AAPL -3.3%) announces its iCloud service will launch on Oct. 12 - allowing AAPL-device owners to keep their music in the cloud.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • ALGN

    Align Technology (ALGN +6.1%) jumps after Jefferies initiates coverage with a buy on valuation...

    Align Technology (ALGN +6.1%) jumps after Jefferies initiates coverage with a buy on valuation with a $21 price target. The firm says its $21 target price is based upon a 10-yr horizon in its DCF model and implies an EV of 10.0x in its 2012 EBITDA forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • OVTI

    Down hard yesterday, OmniVision (OVTI +9.8%) is holding onto today's big gains as Apple...

    Down hard yesterday, OmniVision (OVTI +9.8%) is holding onto today's big gains as Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) announces the iPhone 4S will contain an 8-megapixel camera leveraging an image sensor using backside illumination technology; that's one of the key features of the OmniVision chip expected to go into many 4S units. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -1.8%) introduces the iPhone 4S, to "tepid applause" from an audience hoping for an...

    Apple (AAPL -1.8%) introduces the iPhone 4S, to "tepid applause" from an audience hoping for an iPhone 5. At first glance, the device looks similar to the iPhone 4. The 4S will feature an A5 CPU (the iPhone 4 uses an A4 chip), and support faster 3G (HSPA) download speeds. Apple is thus far selling off modestly on the news. (live blog)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 7 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) jumped 5% higher right before the Apple (AAPL -1.1%) event, before losing it all...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) jumped 5% higher right before the Apple (AAPL -1.1%) event, before losing it all back as a Sprint-Apple deal was not a headliner announcement. Shares now stand down 1% for the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -3.8%) stages a whopping intraday reversal, as shares plunge to new...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -3.8%) stages a whopping intraday reversal, as shares plunge to new 52-week lows at $19.91 after Apple's (AAPL -1.2%) Tim Cook says iPhones comprise 5% of all mobile phone sales but 93% of Fortune 500 companies are testing the iPhone. Shares had spiked earlier on takeover rumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • ACMR-OLD

    A.C. Moore Arts & Crafts (ACMR-OLD +58%) soars after agreeing to be acquired by an affiliate...

    A.C. Moore Arts & Crafts (ACMR-OLD +58%) soars after agreeing to be acquired by an affiliate of arts and crafts distributor Sbar's for $1.60 per share, a 68% premium to yesterday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • STP

    Solar stocks, some of the worst performers of 2011 thanks to a non-stop stream of bad news on...

    Solar stocks, some of the worst performers of 2011 thanks to a non-stop stream of bad news on the demand, pricing, and regulatory fronts, are staging a big rally today, perhaps with some help from covering shorts. STP +17.4%. JKS +16.8%. CSIQ +10.3%. FSLR +5.4%. TSL +7.7%. JASO +6.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • AM-OLD

    American Greeting (AM-OLD -4.6%) and Shutterfly (SFLY -16%) dive on news of Apple's...

    American Greeting (AM-OLD -4.6%) and Shutterfly (SFLY -16%) dive on news of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) new "Cards" app, which lets people send snail mail cards from their iPhone/iPad.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • MMM

    Ceradyne (CRDN +5.1%) pops after saying it's received ceramic body armor delivery orders from...

    Ceradyne (CRDN +5.1%) pops after saying it's received ceramic body armor delivery orders from U.S. Special Operations Command totaling about $6.9M. The specially manufactured, egonomically designed systems are scheduled for delivery in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • AFAM

    Home-health nursing provider Almost Family (AFAM +4.7%) recovers much of yesterdays losses after...

    Home-health nursing provider Almost Family (AFAM +4.7%) recovers much of yesterdays losses after the Senate Committee on Finance's report on its home-health inquiry clears the company of any medicare wrongdoing. In its report, the committee states the company "never pushed therapists to pursue more profitable clinical regimens."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • ARCH

    Coal stocks, hammered yesterday following Arch Coal's (ACI +7.9%) guidance cut, are staging a...

    Coal stocks, hammered yesterday following Arch Coal's (ACI +7.9%) guidance cut, are staging a rally today. PCX +11.4%. BTU +3.5%. ACI +7.9%. ANR +6.2%. [[JRCC] +13.9%. Oil refiners are also in rally mode, thanks to a 1.9% jump in the crack spread. WNR +7.1%. SUN +2.8%. MPC +4.4%. VLO +2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    Adding to AMR's (AMR +17.7%) bounce today is a statement coming from the airline pilots union...

    Adding to AMR's (AMR +17.7%) bounce today is a statement coming from the airline pilots union denying that some pilots were seeking earlier retirement based on special knowledge of their employer's finances. The union says the likely cause was change made by Congress in mandatory retirement age from 60 to 65 created a backlog of pilots who otherwise would have retired at age 60.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.2%) pokes out a gain as the share price retakes the $70 threshold. The...

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.2%) pokes out a gain as the share price retakes the $70 threshold. The Motley Fool raises a question for investors of CAT, by noting that not all free cash flow is created equally with non-recurring items such as tax benefits, accounts payable shuffling and asset sales easy to manipulate. By this metric, CAT generates a higher percentage of FCF from "questionable" cash sources than peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVH

    Warnaco Group (WRC -2.7%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley initiates the shares with an...

    Warnaco Group (WRC -2.7%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley initiates the shares with an underweight. The firm says lack of pricing power in an rising cost environment, plus weak product trends in the U.S. and its large exposure to Southern Europe make the apparel company the weakest of its peers heading into H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) gain 10%, unfazed by an initiation from Imperial Capital at...

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) gain 10%, unfazed by an initiation from Imperial Capital at Underperform. The company is in the spotlight this week after Ralph Steinman - whose work serves as an inspiration to DNDN's prostate cancer therapy - was awarded the Nobel Prize for medicine a mere three days after he died.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (STRI +7.9%) pops after announcing plans to further streamline its U.S. operations...

    STR Holdings (STRI +7.9%) pops after announcing plans to further streamline its U.S. operations and improve its cost structure by shutting down its St. Augustine, Florida manufacturing facility. The move is part of a larger plan to consolidate operations from three smaller production facilities into its larger operation in East Windsor, Connecticuit.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic (SONC -5.9%) takes a hit after it says same-store sales fell in FQ4, missing estimates and...

    Sonic (SONC -5.9%) takes a hit after it says same-store sales fell in FQ4, missing estimates and halting its gradually improving sales trend. Net sales increased 0.4% for company drive-ins, but declined an estimated 0.5% for the overall system.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) jumps 28% higher after the firm announces the FDA has assigned...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) jumps 28% higher after the firm announces the FDA has assigned Nov. 27 as an action date for its review of Intermezzo, following up an earlier positive review of the prescription sleeping aid by the regulator.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • LO

    Lorillard (LO -1.8%) is down this morning after Goldman cuts it to neutral, citing concerns...

    Lorillard (LO -1.8%) is down this morning after Goldman cuts it to neutral, citing concerns about its U.S. tobacco business. The firm says its flagship Marlboro brand is losing market share, and as pricing decelerates across the spectrum, the rest of its current product mix will likely be a drag on earnings as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 3 Comments
  • FST

    Forest Oil (FST +5.5%) is higher this morning after Canaccord raises it to buy from hold on...

    Forest Oil (FST +5.5%) is higher this morning after Canaccord raises it to buy from hold on valuation. The firm sees encouraging potential from its current rigs, as well as from its Eagle Ford stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • AAL

    AMR rebounds, +17.2%, as rumors of its demise that sank shares 33% yesterday look overdone. AMR...

    AMR rebounds, +17.2%, as rumors of its demise that sank shares 33% yesterday look overdone. AMR had the foresight to borrow before any crisis hit, so the airline should end the year with liquidity of more than $3.5B, equivalent to more than 15% of annual revenue. For this reason alone, most analysts see filing for bankruptcy out of choice as unlikely.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Will the 2012 holiday shopping season go down as the year of layaway (audio)? Toys R Us...

    Will the 2012 holiday shopping season go down as the year of layaway (audio)? Toys R Us kickstarted the movement by expanding its layaway service and offering 90-day payment options, while Sears (SHLD) declares "National Layaway Week" at its flagship and K-Mart stores and sees its shares pop 7.8% today. Also looking to catch the layaway wave: WMT, TGT, BBY.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR +9.6%) rallies after Gilford upgrades shares to Buy, citing their low valuation. MEMC...

    MEMC (WFR +9.6%) rallies after Gilford upgrades shares to Buy, citing their low valuation. MEMC has been crushed this year by weak solar demand, which has badly hurt pricing for the solar wafers its sells to module vendors.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.3%) spikes on rumors the company has hired an investment banker to...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.3%) spikes on rumors the company has hired an investment banker to consider strategic options. Just last week, Carl Icahn was rumored to be buying a chunk of the stock. Color Eric Savitz skeptical: RIM is rapidly losing smartphone market share, and the PlayBook is going nowhere - just why would anyone want to buy it?
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment

  • F5 Networks ( FFIV +8.3%) gets a boost from positive comments by William Blair, noting that...

    F5 Networks ( FFIV +8.3%) gets a boost from positive comments by William Blair, noting that while broader macro concerns remain, customers are still spending and its Q4 is showing significant improvement. Additionally, with the stock down over 50% since January, the firm adds it would be aggressive buyers at these levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • S

    J.P. Morgan's Philip Kusick isn't buying yesterday's WSJ report about Sprint (S -7%) committing...

    J.P. Morgan's Philip Kusick isn't buying yesterday's WSJ report about Sprint (S -7%) committing to $20B in iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) purchases, noting the commitment might represent 37% of Sprint's phone sales over the next 4 years. He's also skeptical about Sprint's reported per-iPhone subsidy of $500, given its Android (NASDAQ:GOOG) subsidies are much lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • DXBGY

    Stocks are bouncing fast both here and across the pond. The National Bank of Belgium just hit...

    Stocks are bouncing fast both here and across the pond. The National Bank of Belgium just hit the wires saying the central banks of Belgium and France will fully support Dexia, but did anybody believe anything different? Stoxx 50 2% off the lows, -1.9%. Nasdaq turns green.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • BPZ

    Wunderlich downgrades the oil and gas sector due to a lowered forecast for crude oil prices. The...

    Wunderlich downgrades the oil and gas sector due to a lowered forecast for crude oil prices. The firm cuts the following companies to hold: BPZ Resources (BPZ -8.1%), Clayton Williams Energy (CWEI -9.1%), Concho Resources (CXO -4.1%) and Oasis Petroleum (OAS -8.6%). Additionally, it significantly lowers price targets for: Endeavour International (END -10%) to $9 from $18 and Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS -16%) to $3.50 from $8.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • DYN

    Shares of wholesale electricity providers struggle, led by a 9.3% decline in Dynegy (NYSE:DYN)....

    Shares of wholesale electricity providers struggle, led by a 9.3% decline in Dynegy (NYSE:DYN). The ongoing concern of federal regulators on M&A activity in the sector is helping taint the prospect for future deals. Decliners: NRG -5.5%, CPN -3.2%, DUK -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM

  • WTI crude (USO) is off sharply again, -2.6%, and hitting a $75 handle for the first time since...

    WTI crude (USO) is off sharply again, -2.6%, and hitting a $75 handle for the first time since Sept. 2010. Brent crude (BNO) - likely a better guide as a benchmark - is off a similar amount today to $99.40, but has not yet retraced all of its gains from the past year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • PLCM

    Barclays networking equipment analyst Jeff Kvaal raises ratings on Polycom (PLCM +5.9%) and...

    Barclays networking equipment analyst Jeff Kvaal raises ratings on Polycom (PLCM +5.9%) and Shoretel (SHOR +4.9%), while lowering Riverbed (RVBD -3.4%). Healthy trends in videoconferencing and unified communications should allow PLCM and SHOR to lead networking peers, he writes, but demand for Riverbed may be slower to recover in a downturn.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • MMSI

    Shares of Merit Medical Systems (MMSI +3.2%) knock out a steady gain after Piper Jaffray...

    Shares of Merit Medical Systems (MMSI +3.2%) knock out a steady gain after Piper Jaffray reiterates its Overweight rating. The company is on the fringe of opening up new markets in China and Singapore for its proprietary disposable medical devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • MSPD

    A day after rival Vitesse (NASDAQ:VTSS) cut its guidance, Mindspeed (MSPD -2%) does the same,...

    A day after rival Vitesse (NASDAQ:VTSS) cut its guidance, Mindspeed (MSPD -2%) does the same, though its cut is more modest. Mindspeed expects FQ4 revenue of $40.5M, below prior guidance of $42.2M-$43.9M, and attributes the shortfall to weakening demand in the communications infrastructure market. Will competitors AMCC and PMCS warn next?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM

  • Moments before Chairman Bernanke testifies to Congress, stocks here and across the pond are at...

    Moments before Chairman Bernanke testifies to Congress, stocks here and across the pond are at session lows. S&P 500 -2.2%, Nasdaq -1.5%, Stoxx 50 -3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • GTIV

    Another casualty of the Senate's report on home health services (.pdf), Gentiva Health Services...

    Another casualty of the Senate's report on home health services (.pdf), Gentiva Health Services (NASDAQ:GTIV), loses 17.2% in early trading after Deutsche drastically cuts its price target to $5.50 from $14 to go along with its Hold rating on shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMED

    Amedisys (NASDAQ:AMED) falls 11.5% after Deutsche downgrades to Hold from Buy on its analysis of...

    Amedisys (NASDAQ:AMED) falls 11.5% after Deutsche downgrades to Hold from Buy on its analysis of the Senate's Staff Report on Home Health and the Medicare Therapy Threshold (.pdf). "The findings, in our view, could lead to further investigations and make it incrementally more likely worst-case Medicare rate cuts materialize."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • MS

    The price of protection against default by Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) has naturally risen the past...

    The price of protection against default by Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) has naturally risen the past few sessions. Also note the sharp inversion of the curve, meaning it costs far more to insure against default today than tomorrow. It's a bit too remindful of 2008 for comfort and TARP 2 is likely politically impossible. What next?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • RNOW

    RightNow Technologies (RNOW -3.8%), a provider of cloud-based customer support software, trades...

    RightNow Technologies (RNOW -3.8%), a provider of cloud-based customer support software, trades lower after Roth's Nathan Schneiderman downgrades the company to Neutral. While liking RightNow's growth prospects and believing EPS estimates are too low, Scheniderman thinks there's limited near-term upside to shares, given their high valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • AAL
